html.p: Submit the two online problems in this set (problems 1 and 2) online. Hand in the six written problems in this set (problems 3-8) in your section slot in the boxes outside the door of 32-082 or 26-152 depending on which is your classroom. Make sure you clearly write your name and section on your problem set.
You may download all problems as a PDF file here.
Text: Dourmashkin, Belcher, and Liao; Introduction to Electricity and Magnetism MIT 8.02 Course Notes Revised.

tr.th: Week Five: Capacitors and Capacitance, Dielectrics
Problem Set 4 Due Tuesday March 4 at 9 pm

tr.td:
Conductors and Insulators; Capacitance & Capacitors; Energy stored in Capacitors
Course Notes: 3.3, 4.5, 5.1-5.4

Dielectrics; Conductors as Shields; Expt 1: Faraday Ice Pail Experiment
Course Notes: Sections 5.4, 5.6, 5.8-5.9

PS03: Capacitance, Stored Energy, Capacitors in Parallel and Series, Dielectrics
Course Notes: Sections 5.6, 5.8-5.9

tr.th: Week Six: Current, Magnetic Fields and Forces
Problem Set 5 Due Tuesday March 11 at 9 pm

tr.td:
Current, Current Density, Resistance and Ohm's Law, Magnetic Fields and Forces
Course Notes: 6.1-6.3, 8.1-8.3, 8.5

Magnetic Forces on Current Carrying Wire, Sources of Magnetic Fields, the Biot Savart Law
Course Notes: Sections 8.3, 9.1-9.2

Problem Solving 5: Calculating Magnetic Fields and Magnetic Forces
Course Notes: Sections 8.9, 8.10, 9.10.1, 9.11.1-3, 9.11.7-8
